fields.title: About
fields.description:
Instrument Synchronizer is my Engineering Thesis.

It will take multiple separately recorded instrument voices, fit them and join them

to make a single, good sounding record.

It is meant to work for orchestras as a tool to prepare music remotely.

Doing this by hand takes about an hour for every included instrument,

so this project might save users lots of time.

It will be a web application, designed to be developed further

after passing Thesis.


For now, it is going to be just a working prototype deployed on simple page

as a fulfillment of Thesis requirements.

Later on, way better website will be developed around main app,

code will be refactored to be more efficient and

project will gain new functionalities.

(already have few things in mind)

fields.title: About
fields.description:
"Advent of Code is an Advent calendar of small programming puzzles for

a variety of skill sets and skill levels that can be solved in any programming language you like.

People use them as a speed contest, interview prep, company training,

university coursework, practice problems, or to challenge each other."

Eric Wastl, creator of Advent of Code


I started solving Advent of Code exercises as an opportunity to check my programming skills.

My first touch with this project was in 2019 edition, recommended by my friend.

Now, after few months of learning and improving my skills i am trying to solve

all provided tasks along with maintaining quality of my code.

I do it in free time mostly for fun and trying out myself.

Solutions might be uploaded few times in month.

fields.title: Github
fields.description: Go on and visit Github repository of this project if you wish!

fields.title: About
fields.description:
Portfolio is a project, which i started doing to check out my Django skills.

To avoid throwing away after writing it i had to write

something i could deploy or just keep it as a sample of my code.

What came into my mind was this site, which would be way to express

myself, show my projects and examples of my code.

After all, who would not want to have his own website?


Site style had to be simple, as i am for now more focused on backend.

I came up with an idea of designing it as IDE that i am using, PyCharm.

I skipped some of its fragments to match design with website content.


This project will most likely expand as long as i will be

working on my current or future projects, so propably it will have to

be redesigned every few years to maintain its quality.

For now, paradoxically, i am working on it by working on other projects.
